Sentencas: Because of the generally lower activation energy associated with proton conduction in oxides compared to oxygen ion conduction, protonic ceramic fuel cells (PCFCs) should be able to operate at lower temperatures than solid oxide fuel cells (250 degrees to 550 degrees C versus >= 600 degrees C) on hydrogen and hydrocarbon fuels if fabrication challenges and suitable cathodes can be developed.
Titulo: Readily processed protonic ceramic fuel cells with high performance at low temperatures

Sentencas: We fabricated the complete sandwich structure of PCFCs directly from raw precursor oxides with only one moderate-temperature processing step through the use of sintering agents such as copper oxide.
Titulo: Readily processed protonic ceramic fuel cells with high performance at low temperatures

Sentencas: We also developed a proton-, oxygen-ion-, and electron-hole-conducting PCFC-compatible cathode material, BaCo0.4Fe0.4Zr0.1Y0.1O3-delta (BCFZY0.1), that greatly improved oxygen reduction reaction kinetics at intermediate to low temperatures.
Titulo: Readily processed protonic ceramic fuel cells with high performance at low temperatures

Sentencas: We demonstrated high performance from five different types of PCFC button cells without degradation after 1400 hours.
Titulo: Readily processed protonic ceramic fuel cells with high performance at low temperatures

Sentencas: Power densities as high as 455 milliwatts per square centimeter at 500 degrees C on H-2 and 142 milliwatts per square centimeter on CH4 were achieved, and operation was possible even at 350 degrees C.
Titulo: Readily processed protonic ceramic fuel cells with high performance at low temperatures
